channel.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
channel.description:
If you state that G-Man is Gordon Freeman, then that meanbs that Gordon is just hallucinating everytime he sees him... Right? And since Eli and Alyx have also seen him, they're just a part of his hallucination too, right? And, since Kleiner, Magnusson, and obviously Breen and a lot of other scientists have talked to Eli, they're just a hallucination too, right??? So, if Breen is just a hallucination, that means that the one that hired him is too, and the one that hired Breen also hired every other personal in Black Mesa, therefor they too are hallucinations, and the whole Black Mesa was a hallkucination. So all of the aliens and the combine and the people who lived to see the seven hour war and the portalstorm are hallucinations too, and the whole world saw that, right? So that means that humanity is a hallucination. Right??? And if humanity was created by evolution, then evolution was also a hallucination, and evolution was created by the Big Bang, or whatever created the world, and then that means that the whole world is a hallucination. At least in the game... Or is it? Since neither Gordon, who must be a hallucination himself, or the rest of the world doesn't exist, and since Gordon was created by Valve, that means that Half-Life or Half-Life 2 or any of Valve's games never existed, which means that Valve doesn't exist either. And since all of us have played at least one of their games, we don't exist either. And because of that, all of our generations before us doesn't exist either! So you don't exist, reader, neither do I, or him, or her. This means that the real life evolution doesn't exist either, and that means that NOTHING EXISTS!!! EVERYTHING IS JUST A HALLUCINATION!!!
So, dear readers and noobs, do you guys still think that Gordon Freeman is G-Man? Or do you believe in the above? Your choice...

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
item.dc:creator: The_One_Free_Cake
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

Black Mesa is a government funded facility. There is no question that what he is doing is for the government.

No no no, not the REAL government; I mean the secret alien shadow government that is working with his boss, specifically. As in, like, not Black Mesa, just his boss.

Actually, the idea that Gordon is a paranoid, delusional basket case gets more plausible all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
Vampire95:

Yes, I know that the pictures is a joke, but there are people in other threads, for whom I “dedicated” this one, that actually think that Gordon is G-Man because of the pictures similarity.

Why are people even still replying to Vampire?

He’s been on another thread claiming the combine were the forces in Xen.

In other words he has no idea wtf he is talking about, realises this and backtracks repeatedly in order to save face, he isn’t worth the mental capacity it takes to recognise his name.

Read full topic

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Vampire95:

You guys actually thought that I was serious about this? I was just trying to make a fool of all the G-Man being Gordon believers. I guess I succeeded since you continued to discuss the matter…

Nobody on this forum thinks that Gordon is G-Man. N o b o d y.

Vampire95:

Yes they were… Just because the picture of Gordon Freeman was cut from a picture of G-Man, they actually think that.

Gordon Freeman was not “cut from a picture of G-Man,” whatever the hell that means. They are two independently developed characters. Are you talking about this?

Because that’s a joke. You know, a humorous picture made to invoke feelings of merriment.

Read full topic

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
item.dc:creator: Joe_Freeman
item.description:
The One Free Cake:

I like to think that all of the hallucination stuff is true, except the circumstances were that Gordon hit his head on a metal surface in what was actually a very minor meltdown in the Lambda Chamber and went a bit bonkers due to substantial brain damage, and has been running around smacking his coworkers with crowbars and stealing guns from security guards in an imaginary fight against aliens and the government who are secretly working with his boss.

Yeah, it’s a great ending, since it destroys every single theory that you could have made. It’s like… You open your eyes and look that everything has been just a dream and you’re in a stretcher in a hospital room, in front of you a group of medics trying to save you and to your right there’s a big window showing the blue sky and a group of birds flying across it… And then you think “Everything will be all right” and close the eyes again, dying, since catatonia kills you when you wake up.

Maybe you could wake up and see that G-man is in front of you, but he’s the medic or just a normal worker.

Read full topic

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...
item.dc:creator: Vampire95
item.description:
Fine, whatever.

Anyways, if G-Man is Gordon then Gordon should be able to speak, he should be able to teleport without the help of Black Mesa, he should be able to stop time. He should have black hair. And most importantly, he should age.

Read full topic

item.title: About G-Man being Gordon...

item.description:
I’ll sum em up for you

Firetime:

Time Travel

Kaweebo:

But just on the subject of Gman being Gordon, that’s still one of the stupidest theories I’ve ever heard for Half-Life.

danealsangeo:

Is such a thing even possible? Yeas it is.

geekofalltrades:

Nope! Chuck Testa.

ya know chuck testa, don’t you?

Brockley:

This is probably THE stupidest thread I have ever read. Ever.

OrderOfDagon:

^ Sadly, I have to agree.

noonem:

WTF am I reading?

Joe Freeman and The One Free Cake talked on topic

some gone off topic, some purely talked about gman and blackmesa.

EDIT: This’s my last reply to you. Gonna get back and study harder. I wanna be a relativistic quantum physicist like Gordon Freeman. You should do it too. I mean do something practically.
